content: I am trying to set up an additional mail account to my thunderbird account and it wouldn't allow me to do so because I believe I needed to create a one time password for the thunderbird account so it would recognize it. I created the one time password in my mail account but I don't know where to enter it when I go to add the additional account.

title: Three Months of Emails Disappeared
content: I logged into my email account and almost 3 months of my most recent emails had disappeared. I don't know what happened. They were there the last time I checked my email about 5-10 minutes earlier. I've looked in other folders but they aren't there either. Aso tried repairing the folder with no success. Is there a way to recover these emails? I've been trouble shooting / googling this all afternoon and kept seeing reference to a recovery tool. Is this something already on Thunderbird or software I need to purchase? I really want to know if there is a way to recover the lost emails and how to do it. Thanks.
creator: Sneffels

title: Payment
content: I donated some money when I start using Thunderbird. Why am I asked to pay another payment? I no longer use Thunderbird. Please help me.

title: Problemi continui in uscita mail per orange.fr che non ho usando outlook o la posta elettronica di Apple.
content: Non riesco a capire perché ho spessissimo problemi con l'uscita bloccata delle mie mail orange.fr che a volte si risolvono da soli, a volte no. Ho voluto vedere come funziona con altri sistemi di posta elettronica tali Outlook di Windows e Mail di Apple e con questi non ho nessun problema. Ne concludo che il problema è vostro ma non saprei come risolverlo e sarei spiacente di dover rinunciarci.
creator: aldo-zabban

title: On my Framework 13, Thunderbird crashed.
content: On my Framework 13, Thunderbird has stopped. Message reads Oups! We're sorry, it looks like thunderbird crashed. Please contact the developer if you want to report the issue. At 85, I'm anything but a nerd. Could someone please help me in simple, everyday terms? I have a lot of incoming and outgoing emails, and am completely stuck. Thank you.
creator: vesigond

title: Is my  version 140.3.1esr from ubuntu 22.04 software centre a security risk? should i uninstall immediately
content:
My questions are: 

is my current 140.3.1esr snap download of thunderbird on ubuntu  unsafe and should i remove account and uninstall it immediately? Is there a safer snap version to use.

I was about to add a new account to thunderbird and checked for cves first and saw this CVE-2025-11715. MY version if affected but there is no way to update my installed version to a fixed release in the software centre.

I see 140.4.oesr-1 is available in the drop down menu on the mozilla thunderbird snap page in software centre but its onlt latest/candidate and I dont understand if that means is stable/ok to use?

Clicking on this version doesnt update my current one and instead requires a new install. Is the best idea to go ahead and install this version? and do this would i need to remove the current account in thunderbird and unistall the app before I he one i install a new one?

i have autism and worry about installing the wrong thing, so thought the ubuntu snapstore as the version was verified by canonical would be stable and secure. I am nervous of downloading from browser in case i download a fake or mess it up in some way fake and dont know how to use termial that well.

Please can I get help on the best way to proceed to use a version of thunderbird that is definitly safe to use and add accounts to? Also should i stop using the version 140.3.1esr if the security risk is high, if i dont uninstall it should i stop using until and update is made? do i need to unistall that version it before installing any newer version or could i keep that with its account and install the 140.4 version to add the new account to?

How can I check regularly that what I am running is safe to use if ubuntu doesnt update for months even when there are security risks? Thanks
creator: brew
